webspider.core.indexer
Class IndexerImpl

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.text.html.HTMLEditorKit.ParserCallback
      webspider.core.indexer.IndexerImpl

public class IndexerImpl
extends javax.swing.text.html.HTMLEditorKit.ParserCallback

This class is used to create an inverted vertex of a list of pages. A text file is given as input to the class and it reads the list of URLs from the text file. It then processes the web pages that each URL is associated with and obtains a list of keywords for the page using the text that is present on the page. An inverted index is created from these keywords and saved to an output file.

Author:
Kushal Lyndon D'Souza

parser

public java.lang.String parser(java.net.URL url)
                        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                               java.io.IOException
Parses a webpage by removing all the javascript code as well as css styles and HTML/XML tags. It then returns only the text contained on the page.

Parameters:
url - URL of the page.
Returns:
String containing the text on the page.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - Throws exception if file is not found.
java.io.IOException - Throws IOException.

parse

public void parse(java.io.Reader in)
           throws java.io.IOException
Fuction is used by the parser function. This function actually does parsing of the webpage.It then removes the tags from the page returning only the text contained on the page.

Parameters:
in - Is an instance of the Reader class.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Throws IOException.

deHtml

private java.lang.String deHtml(java.lang.String string)
Removes all the special charecters present in the string. This function also checks for HTML tags and removes them. However, it will not remove any javascript or css code from the page.

Parameters:
string - string containing text from a page.
Returns:
String which has had all the special charecters and any remaining HTML tages removed.
